attributes.title: Seeking the Source - 'By Whom Am I' - Inauguration Of Kena Upanishad
attributes.description: On this historic evening of 4 February 2016, is inaugurated the Kenopanishad or Kena Upanishad of Sama Veda, the second primary (mukhya) Upanishad by His Holiness Paramahamsa Nithyananda, with the chanting of Shanti Mantra (invocation peace chant), while seated divinely in the forest of pure knowledge. With the disciples, devotees and viewers seated in Upanishad before His Holiness through the two-way video conferencing and TV, He introduces Keno Upanishad, which begins with the primeval enquiry - KENA ISHITAM - By Whom – revealing its essence, while making us wonder over the sophisticated  brains and capacities of the Rishis, the perfected Sages, who could capture the most subtle visualisations and reflect the Cosmic truths, which is Awakened Intelligence. "The essence of Isavasya Upanishad is Seeking. The essence of Kenopanishad is Seeking into the very Source, not just WHO AM I, BY WHOM AM I? Enquiring into the Source is Seeking the very source. The essence of today’s satsang is – Seeking the Source, Cosmos. You can capture it by developing the subtle grooves of the brain by evolving complete completion." Before entering to this Upanishad, He requests all to bring Completion, Silence within so He can begin reflecting the subtle most truths of Kena Upanishad, as anything our brain captures and enjoys, our Life will make it as Reality.
